recipes.label: Pursue a Secondary Objective
recipes.startdescription: There's a light flickering there, in the dark distance of the dream - something familiar and intoxicating and wretched. I will hunt after it.

recipes.label: The Fall of Berlin, 1945
recipes.startdescription: Smoke chokes the horizon. An unnumbered, indiscriminate tide of bodies rises, rises - and I am there at its fore, drenched black-red with the gore of Germans and Russians; soldiers and civilians; innocent and guilty. But out there in the night, I can still hear the sounds of battle. Killing, killing. It is not done yet. I lift my hands to the sky, and I smile. My revenge is almost at hand, but Berlin and her people will suffer as I had for just a little while longer.

recipes.label: DESTINY
recipes.startdescription: And then Berlin is gone. I find myself before the valves of the Tricuspid Gate, naked before Glory. But still, the Door will open for me. The Ligeian Kleidouchos joins me with her Key of Days, and as the Tricuspid parts to permit my passing, the light behind the door bleeds from gold to red. Pain sears me, but it is too late: I have followed in the footsteps of He Who Unmakes, Unmakes, and Unmakes. The light takes me. There is a scream.
